body: @lantimes @fornewid I will look into adding native support for this! üòÑ

issue.title: Include day/night mode in cache keys

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

body:
Checked with `3.1.0-SNAPSHOT` and still "day" resources are picked in night mode. From what I was debugging, `isNightMode()` returns true when calling `rawResCacheKey()` in `fromRawRes()`, but false when generating cache key once again in `fromRawResSync`, don't know why ü§î 

Android Q Beta 6, Pixel 2 XL
@plnice Hmm, any chance you have a little more time to debug? I don't want to ship this if it's broken but I don't have time right now to take a look.

@gpeal sure, will have a look at this more tomorrow. Right now I suspect that the wrong `uiMode` value is returned when obtaining it from application context (which is passed to the `fromRawResSync()`, in `fromRawRes()` passed context attribute is used), but will confirm this when I jump into the code and make sure that's the issue.

issue.title: Always use original context (Activity) when obtaining cache key and resource stream to correctly load and handle raw-night resources when the dark mode is on

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Application context isn't reliable source of information about dark mode (uiMode is UI_MODE_NIGHT_NO when the dark mode is on - Activity carries the correct information) and can incorrectly return default resource instead of the -night variant.

Fixes #1305
